thought.text: Since we can't run the full astropy due to build issues, let me focus on understanding the code structure and implementing the solution. Let me analyze the existing transformation structure:

task_list.title: Phase 1: Read and understand the problem
task_list.notes: Analyzed the issue: need direct ITRS to AltAz/HADec transformations that stay within ITRS frame and treat coordinates as time-invariant

task_list.title: Phase 2: Set up and run tests
task_list.notes: Environment has build issues, but we can explore the code structure directly

task_list.title: Phase 3: Explore codebase for relevant files
task_list.notes: Found key files: intermediate_rotation_transforms.py for ITRS transforms, icrs_observed_transforms.py for AltAz/HADec, utils.py for constants

task_list.title: Phase 4: Create reproduction script
task_list.notes: Created test script but can't run due to build issues - will proceed with code analysis

task_list.title: Phase 5: Analyze the fix needed
task_list.notes: Clearly state the problem and solution approach

task_list.title: Phase 6: Implement the fix
task_list.notes: Add the new transformation functions to the appropriate files

task_list.title: Phase 7: Verify the implementation
task_list.notes: Test the fix and ensure it works correctly

task_list.title: Phase 8: Final review and testing
task_list.notes: Ensure all requirements are met and existing tests still pass
